item.title: Emacs org mode changelog for your github repositories
item.description:
youtube

Using emacs org model with src blocks we will create a changelog for your github repositories, showing the git hash, commit message, time and date of the commit and the repository status You can also set a todo status on the git repo in emacs to indicate the machine you have made the changes on, so you know which other machines you need to pull the changes to, you can then add a todo entry showing you have pulled the changes to that machine We with be using noweb to simplify the code and pass in variables for the local path to the git repo, from the src code block for each repo And we will wrap the results in a quote block so they are rendered on github as well changelog git repository https://github.com/NapoleonWils0n/changelog show the git sha sum of local and remote git repositories https://github.com/NapoleonWils0n/cerberus/blob/master/git/show-sha-sum.org

item.title: What's Special About 'M-x shell' in Emacs? - System Crafters Live!
item.description:
youtube

In this stream, we'll take at the 'shell' feature in Emacs to try and understand what makes it unique compared to other built-in options like Eshell and ansi-term. We'll also take a look at how 'shell' is integrated with other packages like project.el and a community package called 'multishell'. ,#gnu #emacs #shell #bash #programming SUPPORT THE CHANNEL: üëç Support My Work: https://systemcrafters.net/how-to-help/#support-my-work üì∞ Subscribe to the Newsletter: https://systemcrafters.net/newsletter/ üëï Check out the Store: https://systemcrafters.store üìò Get Your Copy of Mastering Emacs: https://www.masteringemacs.org/r/systemcrafters?utm_source=yt&utm_medium=desc&utm_campaign=scme SHOW NOTES: https://systemcrafters.net/live-streams/june-20-2025/ JOIN THE COMMUNITY: https://systemcrafters.net/community/ (Forum and IRC chat!) https://fosstodon.org/@daviwil MY CONFIGURATION: (This site is currently down but will be back up soon!) https://config.daviwil.com https://config.daviwil.com/emacs https://config.daviwil.com/systems (Guix) OTHER SERIES: - item.title: Curious and Obsessive | My Emacs For Writers handbook
item.description:
youtube

Finally, after many years of using Emacs for writing, I have assembled what I believe are the key points necessary to take any non-programmer writer gently by the hand into Emacs. DOWNLOAD HERE: https://chris-maiorana.kit.com/products/emacs-for-writers This handbook goes ALL THE WAY from ‚ÄúWhy plain text‚Äù to exporting your Org Mode files to crisp, standard manuscript Microsoft Word formatted documents for the writer‚Äôs market. If you are a technical writer, blogger, copywriter, novelist, or just a weekend short story writer like yours truly, Emacs is the superior composition and editing tool you need to more easily get your ideas out of your head and into the world.

item.title: 022 Ollama Buddy - Prototyping autocompletion #emacs #ollama
item.description:
youtube

Demonstrating a potential implementation for some autocompletion. Select o:qwen2.5-coder:0.5b in configuration (ollama-buddy-autocomplete-model "o:qwen2.5-coder:0.5b") Load up my init file and through a test transient menu toggle on autocomplete and then set manual completion, lets see what happens. I chose qwen2.5-coder:0.5b as it probably the fastest coding local LLM. Basically looking to autocomplete bits and bobs within the init file. https://melpa.org/#/ollama-buddy https://github.com/captainflasmr/ollama-buddy ,#emacs #ollama

item.title: Save the Last Recorded Macro in Emacs to the Registry
item.description:
youtube

``` (use-package session :hook (after-init . session-initialize) :custom (session-globals-include '((kill-ring 10 nil) (session-file-alist 100 t) (file-name-history 200 nil) search-ring regexp-search-ring (register-alist 100 t))) (session-globals-exclude nil)) ;; Optional: clears exclusions ``` My website: https://emacselements.com/ Follow me on Mastodon: https://mastodon.social/@revrari If you enjoy my videos please send me a donation via PayPal: https://paypal.me/revrari

item.title: Agentic LLM use in Emacs using Model Context Protocol (MCP)
item.description:
youtube

Here's a demo using tools in Emacs with the LLMs of your choosing. You can have any mix of "native" Emacs Lisp tools and MCP server tools using a combination of the gptel package and the mycp.el package. 00:00 Introduction 01:50 How to create tools in Emacs Lisp in gptel 08:35 Demo of gptel Emacs Lisp tools 18:00 Model Context Protocol and mcp.el 20:38 mcp.el - github page and configuration examples 26:00 Demo of gptel using MCP servers 42:20 Translate Claude Desktop mcp configs for mcp.el 45:15 mcp-server-lib.el - Write even your MCP servers in Emacs Lisp! My configuration for mcp.el: https://github.com/gregoryg/emacs-gregoryg?tab=readme-ov-file#mcpel---model-context-protocol My gptel configuration (excerpt at will): https://github.com/gregoryg/emacs-gregoryg?tab=readme-ov-file#gptel---llms-in-markdown-and-org-mode My AIPIHKAL repo - prompts for LLMs, including the tool-use prompt I use here: https://github.com/gregoryg/AIPIHKAL Gptel package: https://github.com/karthink/gptel mcp.el package: https://github.com/lizqwerscott/mcp.el

item.title: Time To Format Chat Interactions With Markdown Mode - Emacs Lisp | lesson 09
item.description:
youtube

Free PDF and course üëâ https://tonyaldon.com/chatgpt-emacs-integration-course/ ----- Let's make things look pretty. üé® We learn how to parse JSON responses and format them using Markdown within Emacs. Your chats with ChatGPT will be not only functional but also beautifully organized and easy to read. Markdown magic makes all the difference! - Parsing and Returning a JSON Object with json-read - Accessing Elements in a Nested Structure with map-nested-elt - Inserting the Assistant Response instead of the JSON Response - Formatting with markdown-mode ----- Hi there! üëã I'm Tony Aldon, a passionate Emacs enthusiast dedicated to helping you master Emacs and Emacs Lisp. Join me on an exciting journey with the ChatGPT Emacs Integration Course and master the art of building a fully functional Emacs package from scratch. üåü Through - 18 engaging lessons, - 2.5 hours video content and - 100 pages of PDF you'll: - Master Emacs Lisp: üõ†Ô∏è Customize and extend Emacs like a pro. - Integrate ChatGPT Seamlessly: ü§ñ Enhance your workflow with advanced AI features using the OpenAI API. It can help if you know a little bit of Emacs Lisp, but this is not a requirement as we'll meticulously write, review, and comment on each line of code. üìù

We'll adjust our functions to handle any input you throw its way. - Writing a JSON Object to a File - Writing the OpenAI Request to a File - Updating chatgpt-send - Entering the Prompt from a Buffer ----- Hi there! üëã I'm Tony Aldon, a passionate Emacs enthusiast dedicated to helping you master Emacs and Emacs Lisp. item.title: [Emacs + Polymode + Org-mode] fix unfolding on source block entry
item.description:
youtube

Code with the fix: https://github.com/DeadEarnest/polymode/commit/e0f511e8295f26229494291c1afccaff4a10ef10 Detailed explanation: 1) Going into source block triggers major mode switch, e. g. from Org-Mode to Elisp. 2) This triggers `pm--move-overlays` and inside it, `move-overlay`. 3) `move-overlay` works by removing an overlay from one buffer, and putting it into another. 4) So in result, we delete all overlays from Org-Mode base buffer, and transfer them to Elisp indirect buffer. 5) Non-focused window keeps displaying Org-Mode base buffer, and everything unfolds after overlay deletion. - To avoid deletion of overlays, my solution creates a copy of each overlay in the previous buffer, and puts them in the next buffer. Overlays cannot exist in more than one buffer, so we must copy. - I delete all overlays in the next buffer, before copying into it, to avoid endlessly creating overlay objects. Without this deletion, we quickly get overlay explosion, and Emacs freezes. - `show-paren-match` overlays are not copied, because they get stuck forever if you switch between modes by clicking. - `region` overlay is not copied, because it's not necessary, selection works OK without it. The issue can be avoided by setting ~org-fold-core-style 'text-properties~, but I read that ~org-fold-core-style 'overlays~, is less buggy with poly-org. So I decided to stick with this fix instead of changing the setting.
